intro.title: Hello! I'm Marcos (again)
intro.description: Passionate full-stack developer blah blah blah...
intro.additional: Apart from programming, I have some other passions and curiosities that I'd like to share with you, I think.

modder.title: Ex-Modder and content creator
modder.description: During my childhood/adolescence I was dedicated to making mods for GTA:San Andreas and videos narrated with Loquendo, I would say I don't hate anything but this one goes to the modding community and GTA:SA üñï

caffeine.description: The fuel that keeps my code running or anything else that keeps me awake

knowledge.title: Knowledge nobody asked for
knowledge.description: I'd say I'm that 'Lester' type in social groups, with facts that nobody knows and nobody asks. Did you know that orcas are not whales? They're dolphins.

computers.title: 1. Computers
computers.description: I started with computers at age 4, with a Compaq Presario with Windows Vista, 512MB RAM and a processor that froze every now and then.

career.title: 2. Career decision
career.description: Honestly, I never said 'I want to be a programmer', one day I just passed by an institute with my mother in 2021 and checked their career list and said, 'that one', 'Computer Programming Analyst' and that's it, LMAO. I didn't even think about looking at other options.

hello-world.title: 3. Hello world
hello-world.description: My first 'Hello World' didn't even work, I didn't understand the concept of quotes, I put something like print("hello world) and it never worked. Now that I think about it, I was never very good at school, only at the end I took things seriously and graduated with honors.

heights.title: 4. Buildings, planes, heights...
heights.description: I have a strange fear, I suffer from vertigo, especially with folding stairs, at the same time I feel a great rejection when looking up at a building, I don't know, seeing how tall it is, and the strangest thing is that I'm not afraid of being on a high floor of a building or planes, it's even illogical.

age.question: How old are you?
age.answer: I'm {{age}} years old, or in other words, I'm {{days}} days old, I was born on March 16, 2003 and started in the programming world since I was 18, I never get tired of learning, this explains why my tech stack has so many tools.

language.question: What's your favorite language?
language.answer: The truth is, I don't have a favorite language as such, I just know that the language I hate the most is JavaScript, I hate it with all my being but we are forced to use it, that's life, right? As favorite languages I would say PHP and Python, it's the only thing I use daily practically, but I like to experiment with other languages from time to time.

remote.question: Do you work remotely?
remote.answer: Yes, honestly I hate being around people, going to a place to work in a place surrounded by more people, it's not for me. I prefer a thousand times to work from home, in my space, with my music and my coffee.

freetime.question: What do you like to do in your free time?
freetime.answer: I like to listen to music all day regardless of the time, I do have a special taste for high BPM music, like eurobeat, my favorite genre. I also like to play video games, especially Halo and Star Wars. Also for the good of humanity, I should go out for walks and get fresh air from time to time.

coffee.question: How much coffee do you drink per day?
coffee.answer: At least 3-4 cups, I usually drink about 150mg of caffeine like nothing, there are days when I don't consume anything and others when I overdo it, but on average it's what I consume, an above-average amount.

pets.question: Do you have pets?
pets.answer: Yes, of course. I have many cats, below you'll see all the cats I have, my life companions.

project.question: What was your first project?
project.answer: My first project I'm still building, it's not something computer-related, it's something that goes beyond, I prefer not to tell, but it's a life project, the reason why I wake up in the mornings, the reason to be alive, let's leave it like that, I'm working on something, but it's not ready to show to the world yet. If you come back someday, you'll be among the first to know about the existence of this project!

study.question: Do you study or are you self-taught?
study.answer: A mix of both. After graduating in 2025, I continue studying every day, learning anything on my own, I'm currently thinking about learning graphic design and cybersecurity, to become even more powerful.

waifu.question: Do you have a waifu?
waifu.answer: Like every average geek programmer, yes, I have a waifu, it's Chariot Du Nord, from the Little Witch Academia series. She's a very cute and powerful witch, I like her personality and design.

substances.question: Apart from coffee? Alcohol? Drugs?
substances.answer: Nah, I don't consume any of that, I don't like alcohol or drugs, coffee is culture, it's a lifestyle, alcohol and drugs are dependency, I've always appreciated the concept of freedom, in every sense, and those things tie you to a vice, But doesn't coffee do that? well... according to studies, no...? I think it's a lesser evil.

alias.question: Why is your alias AstronautMarkus?
alias.answer: I don't know, I think the simpler aliases are, the more memorable they are, I mean, what do you think is more memorable 'xX_MarquinhosGaming777_Xx' or 'AstronautMarkus'? It's not easy to find something so simple, I was actually lucky to combine something common like 'Astronaut' with my name, being available even as a domain, besides I'd say it's my way of supporting space exploration, which is something I really like, and 'Markus' is a name I like, it's my name but more 'cool'.

series.question: Favorite series?
series.answer: I'm not really into watching series or television, but if you want me to recommend an awesome series, 'Mr. Robot', the best series I've ever seen, it's about a hacker with mental problems, it's a series that makes you think a lot, and has plot twists that drive you crazy. Do you know why I like it so much? Because unlike other media where 'hacking' is exaggerated Hollywood-level with green colors and Matrix-style animations, here they show real Linux commands, real procedures, it's similar to the realism of Breaking Bad with drugs, here it's with computer science.

videogame.question: Favorite video game?
videogame.answer: Complicated, but to be a bit more friendly I'll say by console, for PC my favorite video game is Halo: Combat Evolved, I used to play it at school when I secretly brought the laptop, don't tell anyone. For PS2 which is the only relevant console I've had, my favorite video game is SOCOM 3: U.S. Navy SEALs, my uncle gave it to me one day, I love that great game, it's so simple but so good.

story.question: Any event you don't like to tell?
story.answer: Yes, more than an event is that when I was little, one day my uncle came with roasted chicken for lunch and brought me a game for the PS2, Devil May Cry, but the 2nd one, you know the dilemma with that game, my uncle's gesture was very nice, something I will definitely do with my nephew, now I'm the uncle, the game is terrible for everyone, for me it's normal, because of course I didn't know anything about the saga, anyway it made me very happy that day, and the roasted chicken was delicious.

os.question: Favorite operating system?
os.answer: I'd say between Manjaro and Linux Mint, both are the 'chill' version of Linux, now I feel 'older' to be setting up an Arch Linux for daily work, I prefer Mint for daily use since it uses Ubuntu as base so packages are stable, and Manjaro for when I want to experiment a bit more, since it's rolling release and has more updated software.

music-coding.question: What music do you listen to while coding?
music-coding.answer: As I mentioned above, I like music with high BPM, like Eurobeat or J-Pop. While coding, I usually listen to 'Toho Eurobeat', a series of albums with Eurobeat music based on the Touhou Project video game series. It's very energetic music that helps me focus and get energized; that kind of music is like a shot of serotonin for my head XD.

bio.title: My Biography
bio.subtitle: The 'Hello World' of my life
bio.personalIntro: Hello, I'm Marcos, my name is quite long, so I just go by "Markus" with my friends and online.
bio.bioFirstPart: I'm a tech enthusiast, especially in networks, IoT, and programming. I enjoy coding for fun and learning new things.
bio.bioSecondPart: I was born on March 16, 2003, in Chile. I currently run my own IT business after graduating as a Computer Programming Analyst from Duoc UC.

early-life.title: Important Events (2003-2019)
early-life.content:
I remember that when I was 4 years old, my parents went into debt to buy me a computer, a Compaq Presario with 512 MB of RAM and the infamous Windows Vista. Around that time, I was also given a PlayStation 2, the only console I had until adulthood.

Back then, I was fascinated by trains, military tanks, railways, and all kinds of heavy machinery. I had many dreams as a child: I wanted to be a train conductor, commercial pilot, soldier, drive a tank, planes, helicopters‚Äîeverything I saw on TV and in books.

When I was very little, it was trendy to buy computer games from kiosks or in cereal boxes. I remember we had lots of computer games on CDs‚Äîhelicopters, planes, racing, etc.

In 2011, for my mother's birthday, my father gave her a laptop, specifically a Samsung RV411 with 4 GB of RAM and Windows 7. That was my first contact with a modern operating system, since the Compaq Presario was very slow and outdated. I'd say that, to this day, that computer was the only thing that truly stayed with me when I needed it most.

During this period, between 2014-2016, I was actively making Loquendo videos of GTA San Andreas under the pseudonym "PayDayGammer334". I made those videos on my mother's laptop and uploaded them to YouTube. A lot happened, honestly‚Äîfriends, mortal enemies, things I wouldn't wish on anyone. The good thing is that all of that is in the past and life goes on.

In 2017, I got a gaming PC after a lot of conflict and after my computer was accidentally broken. That PC was the point of no return with technology. It has a Ryzen 3 2200G, 8 GB of RAM, and a GTX 1050 Ti. That computer is now a server in my rack, my 'personal lab for experiments and testing.'

In 2019, I changed schools and met my most important friends, where I found my reason to keep living in this world, which is *classified*. To this day, I'm still working to achieve it, though I'd say we're still far from finished‚Äîthat's the fun part, right? Also, that year I discovered Eurobeat thanks to Initial D, and became a fan of the genre. To this day, it's my favorite music genre.

higher-education.title: Higher Education, Early Adulthood (2022-2025)
higher-education.content:
In 2022, after the pandemic, I enrolled at Duoc UC in the Computer Programming Analyst program. Contrary to what everyone might think, I did terribly‚ÄîI couldn't even do a 'Hello World' properly, didn't understand quotes, things like that. At that time, I met a professor who, despite his somewhat serious and strict personality, helped me with theoretical concepts I didn't understand then but now understand perfectly: Professor Julio Herrera. Hated by some, loved by others, for me, he was a great support during my studies. It's a shame he left and I never heard from him again.

That year, I also met several people. I went from being a guy with few friends to having quite a few acquaintances. I don't feel like I'm 'close friends' with everyone, but I get along with most, and that's what matters. I met a guy who was my closest friend at university, but he fell behind, ended up failing, and we never spoke again. Maybe I was a bit 'mean,' don't you think? lol.

In 2023, my 'canonical event' happened‚Äîmy 'character development.' As I mentioned, most of the time I did pretty badly in my program, often 'sneaking' into other groups to pass. But that year, everything changed. I got my act together, studied a lot, and managed to get decent grades, though usually thanks to the group and not my own effort. This changed especially in my second semester.

In the second semester of 2023, we took a course called 'Mobile Application Programming,' basically developing phone apps using web technologies, specifically Ionic with Angular ‚ò†Ô∏è. To this day, I hate Angular, but anyway, our team of four decided, instead of making just one app like the other teams, to go all out and try to make four apps at once, creating a front-end microservices system‚Äîwithout even knowing what that was XD. That's when I started taking things more seriously. At that time, ChatGPT was just starting to grow, so it wasn't as viable an option as it is for students today. The professor, colloquially nicknamed "El Harrys", was quite a character, literally.

He was not a standardized teacher at all‚Äîrude, funny, no filters, would literally curse at you if he could, but at the same time, he was insanely good at programming. As a teacher, he was questionable, but as an IT professional, he was a genius. He taught us many things with some questionable examples. You could say he indirectly said var man = 2; var woman = 1; man ">" woman. XD. He was like Terry Davis, a misunderstood genius.

In 2024, now independent as a developer, I was no longer riding on anyone else's effort‚ÄîI could do my own projects, and the best part was, I was doing well. The problem was... now it was my turn to have others ride on my effort, and I didn't like that. I spent two and a half extra semesters with teams that, instead of helping, made the work harder, and I ended up doing everything myself. Luckily, my colleague Pablo appeared as a 'playable character,' and in the last semesters, we carried everything.

In my last semester in 2025, I got the most XD team of all‚Äîthis one was horrible compared to the others. Before, at least I had Pablo's help, but here I was literally alone against the world, about to graduate. Despite everything... I survived. By the way, I passed with a 7.0, the highest grade in Chile. I'd say it's the most epic comeback ever‚Äîfrom someone who didn't even know how to use quotes to not the best student, but someone quite competent, literally.

education.title: Education and Training
education.secondary_description: A place where I grew, both spiritually and mentally. I went from being someone full of anger and sadness to someone with a purpose in life, thanks to the people I met there and the experiences I lived.
education.university_description: My institute, the one that gave me the opportunity to discover what I could achieve if I set my mind to it. They gave me the tools to build empires and break down walls, introduced me to many people‚Äîcolleagues, friends, teachers‚Äîand above all, gave me the chance to grow as a person and a professional. Graduated as a Computer Programming Analyst in July 2025.

personalReflections.title: Personal Reflections
personalReflections.first: Self-sufficiency is the true path to freedom; freedom is the right we all deserve but few achieve.
personalReflections.second: Everyone has the right to change, reinvent themselves, break their chains, and fly free. Even if you don't believe in yourself, there is always a light at the end of the tunnel.
personalReflections.third: I don't seek to be remembered; I want my work to be remembered. I don't seek fame; I want to leave a legacy. I don't seek followers; I want people who believe in what I believe.
personalReflections.fourth: I would say that something we should all reconsider as a species is security. Nowadays, security is increasingly seen as a luxury or privilege for a few, when in reality it should be a basic and universal right.

futureVision.title: Future Vision
futureVision.first: As I mentioned earlier, I don't seek for Marcos Reyes Mart√≠nez to be remembered; I want his work to be remembered, for AstronautMarkus or Reyes&Friends to be remembered for building empires, for helping the clients who needed us, for supporting the lost souls who needed the help I once needed. I want my work to speak for me, and for the people who believe in what I believe to remember me for that.
futureVision.second: I hope that in the future I can finish my secret project, that everyone can appreciate my work, appreciate it, love it just as I did when in 2019 I found my purpose in life, and that we can all live in a better, safer, freer, fairer, and more humane world.
